section.title: Five Golden Tickets
section.p: After not being heard from for decades, Willy Wonka announces in the newspaper that he will allow five children to tour his chocolate factory. To win this exclusive chance, each child must find a golden ticket inside of a Wonka chocolate bar.
Grandpa Joe encourages Charlie, but Charlie knows his family can only afford a Wonka chocolate bar once a year for his birthday. His chances of finding a golden ticket seem hopeless.

His family gifts him the Wonka bar on his birthday. Unfortunately, there was no golden ticket to be found in his bar. Grandpa Joe, knowing Charlie is disappointed, sneaks him money to buy another bar. However, he still does not find a golden ticket.
At this time, four of the five golden tickets have been found.
Time passes and the Bucket family continues to be financially burdened, and Charlie’s dream of visiting Wonka’s chocolate factory is almost gone.
One day as Charlie is walking home, he finds a dollar bill. He takes a chance to buy one more Wonka bar and he finds the golden ticket!
